description.narrative: The proposed investment is a debt facility of up to US$45 million equivalent to support Destination Capital (DesCap or the Asset Manager)s Descap1 Private Equity Trust (the Trust) to acquire up to eight distressed 4-star hotels in Thailand. The Trust plans to renovate, rebrand and reposition these assets in order to capture returns when the market rebounds from the current pandemic in 3-4 years

Job creation: The project will help maintain and support hundreds of jobs which may otherwise be terminated. Energy efficient renovation of buildings supports further employment - and the green refurbishment of hotel assets is expected to create even more jobs. Sustainability: The proposed fund will be one of the first green funds globally earmarked for acquisition and refurbishment, marking an important milestone for the sector in the country. Tourism constitutes a substantial portion of Thai GDP and the implementation of sustainable, green development and operating practices of real estate and hotel companies is critical to the sustainable growth of the sector. This green fund will also set a precedent for other fund managers, as well as being a benchmark for similar investments in the property and hospitality sectors elsewhere.
